intro: Arabis morrisonensis, commonly known as Morrison's rockcress, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
